description: Climb this 1,815-foot-tall observation tower to have the whole of Toronto at your feet and overlook up to 100 miles on a clear day. Once the tallest structure on Earth for over 30 years, the CN Tower attracts travelers to its two observation decks—one of which features a glass floor. If you’re looking for an extra thrill, try Edgewalk, where you can walk hands-free on a ledge surrounding the top floors. The tower is also home to the award-winning 360 Restaurant, which completes a rotation around the structure every 72 minutes, giving you an ever-changing view of the city while you dine. – Tripadvisor

reviews.title: Stunning views of Toronto
text: The CN Tower was just amazing. I decided to go after 5pm and that way I could take pictures of the city both day and night. The views were stunning and there is so much activity happening in and around the city.

reviews.title: Amazing Place! My Experience
text: Efficient network security, Professional and they deliver.  It's been a pleasure working with the expert ( hackerspytech At g ma il co m ) with the aim of hacking and monitoring phones and other devices belonging to some of our employees that were suspected of misconduct. reviews.title: Visit Toronto CN Tower With My Signature Pose
text: In almost every city in developed countries, there is a tower. The CN Tower in Toronto, Canada, is one of them. This photo was taken with my signature pose during my visit to Toronto's CN Tower on July 25th of this year.

reviews.title: Very bad experience
text: The experince was very poor. The ticket price is very high for the experience. Not recommended. The view is not worthy..

reviews.title: A Must-See Icon of Toronto!
text: A Must-See Icon of Toronto!
Visiting the CN Tower was one of the highlights of my trip to Toronto! This iconic landmark offers an unforgettable experience that I would highly recommend to anyone visiting the city.

The views from the top are simply breathtaking! Once you reach the observation deck, you’re treated to 360-degree panoramic views of Toronto and beyond. On a clear day, you can see all the way to Lake Ontario and even Niagara Falls in the distance. The glass floor section is thrilling – standing on it and looking straight down is an exciting and unique experience!

The staff were friendly and helpful, and everything was well-organized, from ticketing to the elevator ride to the top. The entire experience felt smooth and enjoyable. There’s even a great gift shop at the base with plenty of souvenirs to remember your visit.

Overall, the CN Tower is a must-see attraction in Toronto. Whether you're there for the views, the glass floor, or the thrilling EdgeWalk, it's an experience you won't forget. I highly recommend it to anyone visiting the city!

reviews.title: Iconic Views
text: The CN Tower offers stunning views of Toronto and Lake Ontario, with the see-through glass floor adding an exciting thrill. Walking on it gives a unique perspective of the city below.

reviews.title: Great view
text: This was a great way to see where you are in the city. The views are great. Once back on the ground you can recognize where you are!

reviews.title: Toronto CN tower
text: Great experience and view from CN tower. There is a snack bar on the viewing level where you can sit and have lunch/snacks and leisurely enjoy the view.  Views were great and the immersive art was a nice surprise !

reviews.title: Truly unforgettable
text: This iconic landmark offers breathtaking 360-degree views of the city. We enjoyed the thrilling glass floor experience and the revolving restaurant for a romantic dinner. The EdgeWalk, for adrenaline seekers, provides an exhilarating hands-free walk around the tower's exterior. Whether you're after stunning vistas, fine dining, or heart-pounding excitement, the CN Tower delivers an unparalleled urban adventure for couples.

reviews.title: Excellent
text: I enjoyed the food in the canteen tower I had poutine and it is my favourite thing to have when I am in Canada and I would come here again.

reviews.title: Amazing
text: Absolutely amazing tower.incredible experience.Amazing views of toronto city from the top.you must visit the tower to complete your visit to toronto.

reviews.title: Very unimpressive! Do something else in Toronto.
text: Glad I got the senior rate for the CN tower review as there’s not much to it. While you can get a nice view of the city and the water and islands surrounding it, that’s all there is.  I’d rather walk the streets of the city to get a feel for Toronto than look at it from on high.  Beware the photo they take as you enter.  If you decide to buy one with an artificial background, it’s $35 Canadian, $40 for two.  Better to take your own camera and shoot a photo with the city or islands in the background.

reviews.title: Amazing views
text: This place is located on the Harbour side and it looks amazing at night time when it’s lit up.
I would recommend this place to anyone who wants to go and visit a historic place.

reviews.title: Go for the view not the food
text: I visited the CN Tower while on a business trip with colleages. Its a very impressive experience , the whole restuarant rotates giving you a 360 degree view of the city , the food on the other hand didnt live up the the rest of it , we mainly ordered steaks and the quality was very poor for premium cuts, we had been enjoying better steaks all week in resturants in the area and they didnt come close, so overall a great experience let down by the quality of the food.

reviews.title: Top of the world
text: I can’t miss this tower. The CN tower provides unparalleled views of the city of Toronto. Amazing view from the top. I went there with my husband during sunset time. It was fantastic, Amazing view. For an extra $10 you can go higher which we did go higher and you do feel the difference.

reviews.title: Iconic Tower
text: It doesn’t matter how many times we visit Toronto (10th Canadian Trip) no way can you miss this trip out. Went to the very top viewing gallery for those extra 100 metres and it really does add to the trip. The glass floor used to spook me but now I really look forward to standing on it and looking down. Fantastic trip and hope it stands for many more years

reviews.title: Shaky!!!
text: The day we visited, it was raining and cloudy. So we thought it wasn't a good day, but it was the only one we've got.
It was so worth it!!
THe tower was moving... they were even stopping the elevator service to the top floor, because it was moving... A LOT!!!!
It was impressive to see that the tower was build predicting the "movement" of the wind.
Also, the city view is breathtaking!!!!!

reviews.title: Great views over Toronto
text: Absolutely stunning views and a great way to see Toronto.
Only downside was rather long queues to get in despite pre-booked time slots, but as we visited in august it was peak season.

reviews.title: An expensive day out with my daughter and grandchild.  I'm surprised when the health department checks them out to give
text: We enjoyed the tower experience.It was grouped with the aquarium ticket.  I've always been afraid to go up but this year I gave it a go.  I did enjoy it and I didn't Find it scary.  We ate the vue bistro Up in the tower.  The food was mediocre. The table had mold all over it in the cracks.

reviews.title: The cn tower
text: It was amazing experience going very high and se the city. I would recommend going there in the morning. This was included in the toronto city pass which I got.

reviews.title: Must-Visit Attraction with Stunning Views
text: Highly recommend going to the top of the Tower! The views are absolutely fantastic, and the journey up in the lift is a highlight itself, giving you a chance to watch the city slowly descend below as you ascend to 553m. Once at the top, you’re treated to breathtaking 360-degree views of the entire city, plus there are plenty of seating areas and cafes to relax and take it all in.
Getting up and down can be a bit of a process because it’s so popular, but it’s well worth it. The facilities are great, with plenty of washrooms available. A must-see if you’re in the area!

reviews.title: Stunning Views
text: The CN Tower was a must do on our visit to Toronto.  We’d heard stories about massive queues but we booked tickets for a morning slot (10:30 am) and we walked straight in.  It wasn’t particularly crowded up the top either.  Sadly the weather wasn’t as good as it could have been so the views were a bit cloudy and we could see rain in the distance but you can still see a long way.  Well worth the visit.

reviews.title: Fabulous views
text: We were lucky with the weather.  It was a calm day and very clear.  What a great experience.  It was easy and very well organised to get through security.  You take the elevator to the top.  There may be a small wait to get to the top floor as the lift is smaller and some people need to travel down to allow more up.  The views are amazing.  We were brave enough to do the walk outside but you can look down on those doing it which is an experience in itself.  Worth the money to go.

reviews.title: Enjoy the Thrill....and the View!!
text: This is one of those things that you need to do when visiting Toronto!!  The view is spectacular and the observations decks are a lot of fun.

reviews.title: Views
text: My partner and I had an amazing time visiting Toronto, and the CN Tower was the highlight of our trip. The panoramic views from the top were breathtaking, and walking on the glass floor was an unforgettable thrill! Toronto's vibrant atmosphere, diverse neighborhoods, and fantastic food made our visit even more special. We highly recommend the CN Tower for anyone exploring this incredible city.

reviews.title: It's an expensive window to look out of but worth it if you like a good view.
text: it was $168 for 1 adult, 1 senior and 2 kids (7 and 9). once you're through security you can go and queue for a lift, they kind of cram you in so get a spot near the door if you want to be able to see out of a window while you travel in the elevator.
it wasn't busy when we went, it was a friday, but i imagine weekends and holidays would make this much less enjoyable.

great views once you get up there, and the glass floor is cool, then you realise you're not actually at the top. if you want to see out of the top windows you'll need to pay another $11 each to get in another lift and go up 30 more floors.
we didn't visit the 360 restaurant so you won't see that unless you have a dinner reservation as it's gated off and has a separate entrance.

it was a nice place, and a decent gift shop but it's very expensive. you could easily be in and out in an hour, we were about an hour and a half as one of the party wanted to go to the top and you have to get another ticket and another queue to do that.
you can also eat up there as there's a little bistro to get food and drink so you could definitely stay longer if you wanted.

reviews.title: Good view but not worth the price
text: Good views but that’s about it. Not worth spending the money they charge and especially paying extra for higher observatory.

reviews.title: Wonderful experience!
text: Wonderful experience! If you want to have a 360° view of the city, the CN Tower is your place. Visit it in the early morning to avoid the queue. Restaurant is ok but if you want just to see the city the ticket, that is not cheap, to the top of the tower is more than enough

reviews.title: Impressive
text: Amazing experience. The views were unbelievable. We had a clear day so we could see everything. The restaurant on the top deck was fantastic. Food and service very good

reviews.title: Beautiful day
text: If you check the weather forecast and arrive, you won't encounter any surprises. We went on a very beautiful day. The weather was sunny. The tower moves and feels very interesting. And the view is already breathtaking!
